page.title: 06Marston, People
page.content: The parish had a 1981 population of 2723.It is a youthful population, the largest age group (25.8%) being those under 15, and only some 6.9% being of pensionable age. Occupations were traditionally agriculture,clay extraction and Brick manufacture as many were employed by the London Brick Company.New estates have been built in recent years which have been purchased by persons working outside the parish in a variety of occupations.Marston Moretaine is close tom the M1 and therefore attractive to those who wish to commute to London. In 1981.59.85% of households lived in owner-occupied property and 29.55% rented from the council.Some 78.46% of households possessed a car.
